page.title: 08INDUSTRY COFFEE TEA
page.content: Ferndown has an{Industrial Estate}and one of the firms is{Keith Spicer Tea {and Coffee Ltd.}My Grandpa started the company 50 years ago. My Dad joined 23 years ago and is Deputy Managing Director. He often has to drive a long way to see important customers. Through the main door is the reception desk. The offices are upstairs. The laboratory, where the tea and coffee are tasted, is at the end of the corridor. My Dad sometimes tastes the tea and coffee as a check. The main part of the factory is where they roast the green coffee beans, grind and pack them. They import tea (in chests) and make it into tea bags with machines; 24 million a week. You have to wear a white overall in the factory. There is a staff of about l00 in the offices.
